turns.speaker: DUKE LETO
turns.text: What's that you're saying?

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: A Third Stage Guild Navigator will be here within minutes!

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: We felt his presence.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: I shall want telepathy during his visit and a report when we're finished.

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: Their minds are so.... They move in strange directions....

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: Forced spice evolution of humans changes many things.... I must sit close to him.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: He will not permit anyone but me to see him. You must be outside this room.... Do what you can.

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: I am your Truthsayer, my lord...  He is here, my lord.

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: Yes, my Lord.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: We are alone...

turns.speaker: NAVIGATOR
turns.text: We have just folded space from Ix...

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: Yes?... How was your journey?

turns.speaker: NAVIGATOR
turns.text: Many machines on Ix... new machines.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: Oh yes? -- NAVIGATOR Better than those on Richesse.. You are transparent... I see many things... I see plans within plans.

turns.speaker: NAVIGATOR
turns.text: I see two Great Houses -- House Atreides, House Harkonnen -- feuding... I see you behind it.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NAVIGATOR
turns.text: You must share with us. -- EMPEROR The Atreides house is building a secret army!... using a technique unknown to us... a technique involving sound. The Duke is becoming more popular in the Landsraad... he could threaten me.... I have ordered House Atreides to occupy Arrakis to mine the spice... thus replacing their enemies the Harkonnens.... House Atreides will not refuse because of the tremendous power they think they will gain. Then, at an appointed time Baron Harkonnen will return to Arrakis and launch a sneak attack on House Atreides... I have promised the Baron five legions of my Sardaukar terror troops.

turns.speaker: NAVIGATOR
turns.text: So the Harkonnens will rid you of House Atreides...

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: Can you hear me?... If this visit has anything to do with spice... -- The Guild Navigator shudders and swishes quite violently in his tank.

turns.speaker: NAVIGATOR
turns.text: LISTEN TO ME!! The spice must flow... the spice has given me accelerated evolution for four thousand years... it has enabled you to live two hundred years... the spice helps make the sapho juice, which gives the red-lipped mentats the ability to be living computers... the secret side of spice... the water of life.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: I can assure you...

turns.speaker: NAVIGATOR
turns.text: Do not interrupt!!! Do not speak lightly of the spice... ONE SMALL POINT...

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: So, this is Leto the Just...

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: I hope I made myself clear. You may call him "The Duke," "My lord," or "Sire." And there is a more ancient term you might keep in mind -- "Noble Born."

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: Play out your little comedy while you can off-worlders...

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: The Duke is to be addresses as... -- Kynes comes forward and adjusts the Duke's suit, checking seals and pulling on straps.

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: Basically...

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: Sire!

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: Yes, Sire.

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: It's a high-efficiency filter and heat exchange system. Perspiration passes through the first layer and is gathered in the second. The salt is separated. Breathing and walking provide the pumping action. The reclaimed water circulates to catchpockets from which you can drink through this tube at your neck. Urine and feces are processed in the thigh pads. Should you be in the open desert, remember to breathe in through your mouth, out through the nose tubes.

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: Dust cloud ahead, Sire.

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: That's it... spice mining... no other cloud quite like it. See the spotters over it? They're watching for wormsign... the telltale sand waves. Seismic probes on the surface, too Sire... worms can travel too deep for their waves to show... Looks like a good patch of spice.

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: No music. I'm packing this for the crossing. Shield practice.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Shield practice? Gurney... we had practice -- this morning..... I'm not in the mood.

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: Not in the mood?! Mood's a thing for cattle and love play... not fighting.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'm sorry Gurney.

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: Not sorry enough.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What's gotten into Gurney? He's not faking. Paul presses forward and the fight moves quickly around the room. The smell of ozone grows stronger as the shields hit and SPARK off one another. Paul directs a parry downwards, turns, and leads Gurney against the table, plunging at just the right moment to pin Gurney against the table top with his blade right at Gurney's neck.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Is this what you seek?

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: Good... the slow blade penetrates the shield... but look down.

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: We'd have joined each other in death. However, you did seem to finally get the "mood".

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Would you really have drawn my blood?

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: If you'd fought one whit below your abilities I'd have scratched you a good one.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Things have been so serious here lately.

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: Yes. I sensed the play in you lad, but this can no longer be play. Tomorrow we leave for Arrakis! Arrakis is real. The Harkonnens are real.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You've no need of your weapons with me Gurney Halleck.

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: Paul!!  Paul!!

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Don't you trust your own eyes.

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: They said you were dead.  They said...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Gurney... I see Thufir Hawat among the captives.  Let him stand free.

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: My Lord?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Let him stand free!

turns.speaker: GURNEY
turns.text: This is a Harkonnen animal.  Let me, please, my Lord.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The Emperor's blade.

turns.speaker: STILGAR
turns.text: Perhaps these are the ones Mapes told us of.

turns.speaker: STILGAR
turns.text: Are you trained in the ways of the desert?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: No, but many consider my training valuable.

turns.speaker: STILGAR
turns.text: I will take the boy-man... he shall have sanctuary in my tribe... -- A LOW NOTE on a dip stick is blown by one of the Fremen tribe.  Jessica shifts, Paul sees it, and just as Stilgar begins a reach for his weapon, Jessica turns, slashes out, utters a SOUND, whirls again and with rock behind her holds Stilgar helpless in front of her -- her hand at his throat. Paul moves on her first move.  He races up a rocky incline.

turns.speaker: STILGAR
turns.text: Stop!  Get back!!  She has the weirding way.  Why didn't you tell us!  Great gods... if you can do this to the strongest of us you're worth ten times your weight of water.  As a leader of my people I give you my bond: teach us this weirding way and you both shall have sanctuary.  Your water shall mingle with our water.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Then I will teach you our way of battle....  you have the word bond of a Bene Gesserit.

turns.speaker: STILGAR
turns.text: Sayyadina.  Our Reverend Mother tells me she is too old... She has been calling through space and time for you to come and let her rest.  She asks that you pass within.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: They want me to take the Water of Life... the Truthsayer drug... so dangerous, yet... we must move swiftly if we're to secure our place among these Fremen.  I will try to pass within.

turns.speaker: STILGAR
turns.text: Death may be the result....  Are you sure?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: I must do this for Paul, but what of my unborn child?

turns.speaker: MAPES
turns.text: You know the ancient tongues?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: I know the Bhotani Jib and Chakobsa, all the hunting languages.

turns.speaker: MAPES
turns.text: As the legend says.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: That's it! The Missionaria Protectiva has been here planting protective legends against a day of Bene Gesserit need. And that day has come. I must play out this sham.  I know the Dark things and the way of the Great Mother. Miseces prejin.

turns.speaker: MAPES
turns.text: Do you know this my lady?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: It could only be one thing....  It's a crysknife.

turns.speaker: MAPES
turns.text: Say it not lightly...  Do you know its meaning?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Here is why this Fremen has taken service with me, to ask that one question. Delay is as dangerous as the wrong answer. Shadout is Chakobsa... knife, in Chakobsa is... maker of death.  It's a maker...

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Maker?... Maker is the key word... the tooth of the worm? That was close...  Did you think that I, knowing the mysteries of the Great Mother, would not know the maker?

turns.speaker: MAPES
turns.text: My lady, when one has lived with prophecy for so long, the moment of revelation is a shock.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Paul, this is the Reverend Mother Gaius Helen Mohiam. She is going to... observe you...  Please... -- REVEREND MOTHER Jessica, you know it must be done. I enjoin you to stand guard at the door and practice the meditation of peace.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Your Reverence.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What does she fear?  What about my Father?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Paul... please, Paul... listen to the Reverend Mother and do what she tells you.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Don't touch my mother...

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Oh great mother!  He's trying the voice. The Reverend Mother said it could save him.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Remove her gag!

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Excellent!

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I can't maintain any altitude... we'll never reach the safety of rock.  Maybe that small rock.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Where are we do you think?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The South Polar regions... the forbidden area.  We must make it to that rock...

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: A million deaths are not enough for Yueh...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Where are my feelings... I feel for no one...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Listen to me!... you wanted to know about my dreams... and I've just had a waking dream... do you know why?... -- JESSICA Calm yourself/

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The spice!  It's in everything here.  The air, the soil, the food...  It's like the Truthsayer drug.....  It's a poison!!!! You knew the spice would change me.  But thanks to your teachings it's changed my consciousness.  I can see it... I can see it.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Is he....?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You carry my unborn sister in your womb!

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: He knows.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You and your Bene Gesserit sisterhood... I'm not your Kwisatz Haderach...  I'm something different, something unexpected!  I'm a seed.  I am so much more...  You don't begin to know me...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: It's further than I thought... a worm is sure to come....  I'll plant a thumper, that should divert it. -- Paul moves off into the shadows.  Suddenly, Jessica SEES a burst of LIGHTNING illuminate the mountain of rock in the distant and the vast dunes before them.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: ...the night is a tunnel... a hole into tomorrow... if we're to have a tomorrow...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Remember... walk without rhythm and we won't attract a worm... it'll go to the thumper.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: I'm ready.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Run!

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: I can't... I can't.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Cinnamon... the spice!  Do you smell it?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I know the secret.  The worm is the spice... the spice is the worm.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: What's happened?...  Why did it leave?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Someone started another thumper....  We're not alone.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Man-carved steps.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Stop him yourself.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You saw a part of what the race needs in the beginning.  In time you perverted the truth.  You sought to control human breeding and intermix a select few according to a selfish master plan.  How little you understand.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Are you a Fremen?

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: I am a servant of the His Majesty the Emperor. I have served His Majesty on Arrakis long enough for my eyes to change.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: He's hiding something.

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: You've worn a stillsuit before?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: Your suit is fitted desert fashion. Who told you how to do that?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: No one. It... seemed the proper way.

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: That it is.  He shall know your ways as if born to them.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Will we see a worm?

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: Where there is spice and spice mining there are always worms.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Always?

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: Always.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Why do they come?

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: To protect their territory. Vibrations attract them. -- PAUL  I've registered him now... a knife is a sheath on his left arm... He's strong... a person born to command... He's hiding many things.  Is there a relationship between the worms and the spice?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Spice!... pure un-refined spice!

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: Bless the Maker and his water... Bless the coming and going of him.  May his passage cleanse the world.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Liet?

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: You are about to witness something few have seen -- watch!  Watch!

turns.speaker: STILGAR
turns.text: You have strength... real strength... You shall be known as Usul, which is the strength of the base of the pillar.  This is your secret name in our troop.  But you must choose the name of manhood which we will call you openly.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What do you call the mouse shadow in the second moon?

turns.speaker: STILGAR
turns.text: We call that one Muad'dib.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Could I be known as Paul Muad'dib?

turns.speaker: STILGAR
turns.text: You are Paul Muad'dib, and your mother shall be a Sayyadina among us....  We welcome you.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Water on Arrakis!!! I have seen this place in a dream.  A treasure.

turns.speaker: STILGAR
turns.text: Greater than treasure, Usul.  We have thousands of such caches.  Only a few of us know them all.  When we have enough... we shall change the face of Arrakis. Listen!...

turns.speaker: STILGAR
turns.text: The Water of Life.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The most lethal poison in the Universe.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: My own name is a killing word.  Will it be a healing word as well?

turns.speaker: STILGAR
turns.text: Usul... these are fifteen of our fiercest fighters to serve you as your guard... the Fedaykin.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We surprised a band of smugglers.

turns.speaker: STILGAR
turns.text: Too bad... thought they were Harkonnen.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Long live the fighters!

turns.speaker: STILGAR
turns.text: Long live the fighters!

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What's in the box?

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: Pain.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The Voice again.

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: I hold at your neck the gom jabbar. Don't pull away or you'll feel that poison. A Duke's son must know about many poisons -- this one kills only animals.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Are you suggesting a Duke's son is an animal?

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: Let us say I suggest you may be human. Your awareness may be powerful enough to control your instincts. Your instincts will be to remove your hand from the box. If you do so you will die. You will feel an itching -- there... see? Now the itching becomes burning... heat, upon heat, upon heat.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: It burns.

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: SILENCE... SILENCE.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear... I will permit it to pass over me and through me. -- The Reverend Mother moves her face up to his. Her ancient face with its metal teeth gleaming inches away breathes hotly. She is smiling.

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: You feel the flesh crisping?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: THE PAIN!

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: NO!! ENOUGH!! Kull wahad! No woman child ever withstood that much. I must have wanted you to fail. Take your hand out of the box and look at it, young human.... Do it!

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: Pain by nerve induction... A human can resist any pain. Our test is crisis and observation.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I see the truth of it. -- REVEREND MOTHER  Could he be the one?... Maybe... but will he be ours to control?  You know when people speak the truth?

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: Your mother wants you to tell me about your dreams. I only want to know one thing.... Do they come true?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Not all of them... I know which ones will.

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: Perhaps you are the Kwisatz Haderach.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: The person who can be many places at once... the one who bridges space and time.... He will look where we cannot.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: Do you know of the Water of Life?... the Truthsayer drug?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I have heard of it. -- REVEREND MOTHER It is very dangerous... very painful. The Bene Gesserit sisterhood drink it to see within.... There is a place terrifying to us... to women. It is said a man will come... the Kwisatz Haderach... he will go where we cannot... Many men have tried...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Did they try and fail?

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: They tried and died....  Jessica!

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: I sense your teachings in him. Ignore the regular order of training. His safety requires The Voice.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I've heard enough of my safety... What about my father?... I heard you talking. You speak as if he was dead. Well, he isn't!

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Well he isn't... and he won't die... Tell me he won't die!

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: What can be done has been done.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: MOTHER! Tell me!

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: ... Many men have tried.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Did they try and fail?

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: They tried and died.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Don't try your powers on me.  Try looking into that place where you dare not look. You'll find me there staring back at you!! You Bene Gesserit have waited ninety generations to produce the one person your schemes required.  Here I stand.  But... I will never be yours.

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: Stop him, Jessica!

turns.speaker: REVEREND MOTHER
turns.text: You mustn't speak of...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: SILENCE!

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I heard you, Dr. Yueh and Gurney coming down the hall.

turns.speaker: THUFIR
turns.text: Those sounds could be imitated.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'd know the difference.

turns.speaker: THUFIR
turns.text: Yes. Perhaps he would at that.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: My father sent you to test me. Music then?

turns.speaker: THUFIR
turns.text: Many dangers exist on Arrakis. For one, we know the Harkonnens would not have given up their CHOAM company contract so easily.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The Harkonnens are our enemies, yes... but behind them, I suspect, is the Emperor. -- THUFIR You will make a formidable Duke!

turns.speaker: THUFIR
turns.text: Now remember... the first step in avoiding a trap is knowing of its existence.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I know.  But if it is a trap then why are we going?

turns.speaker: THUFIR
turns.text: We have our new army.  Dr. Yueh, put the weirding module on him.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Greetings.  I am the Count.

turns.speaker: HOST
turns.text: Greetings.  I am Slick Slomopavitz, Seeker of Adventure.

turns.speaker: HOST
turns.text: Say, that's a funny place to sleep.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: It is my home.

turns.speaker: HOST
turns.text: Oh, tract housing, huh?  I guess I shouldn't complain about my duplex in Burbank.  What a dump. Some places have a Murphy bed, this place has a Murphy <u>shower</u>.  I still don't know where to hang the towels!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Uh, beg to differ.

turns.speaker: HOST
turns.text: "Beg to differ?!"  Hey, I'm talkin' about my duplex in Burbank!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Uh, Greetings.  I am the Count...

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Mr. <u>Lugosi</u>!  It is an unparalleled privilege to meet you.  Allow me to introduce myself... I am CRISWELL!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: It's a pleasure...

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Ah, cheer up!   Don't lose heart over what happened tonight.  I predict that your next project will be an outstanding success!

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Bring me two more Beefeater martinis. Eddie will have another whiskey, Dagmar's a Rum-and-coke, Moustapha and King are chablis -- hey Bela, would you like a wine?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: No.  I never drink -- wine.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: So <u>you</u> sleep in coffins?!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Yes.  There is nothing more comfortable.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: I can't believe this!  <u>I</u> sleep in coffins!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: YES!  My father ran a mortuary -- it's an old habit!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Eddie, where are we?  We passed that carwash twenty minutes ago.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: I predict we're lost.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Excuse me, Mr. Lugosi??

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I told you, I don't want any of your goddamn coffins.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No.  I don't work here.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Who are you?  What do you want?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I don't want anything.  I'm just a really big, big fan.  I've seen all your movies.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Ha!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Why were you buying a coffin?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Because I'm planning on dying soon.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Yes.  I'm embarking on another bus- andótruck tour of "Dracula." Twelve cities in ten days, if that's conceivable.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You know, I saw you perform "Dracula."  In Poughkeepsie, in 1938.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Eh, that was a terrible production. Renfield was a drunk!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I thought it was great.  You were much scarier in real life than you were in the movie.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I waited to get your autograph, but you never came outside.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I apologize.  When I play Dracula, I put myself into a trance.  It takes me much time to re-emerge.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Oh, there's my bus.  Shit, where's my transfer?!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Don't you bave a car?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I refuse to drive in this country. Too many madmen.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Boy, Mr. Lugosi, you must lead such an exciting life.  When is your next picture coming out?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I have no next picture.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Ah, you gotta be jokin'!  A great man like you... I'll bet you have dozens of 'em lined up.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Back in the old days, yes.  But now -- no one give two fucks for Bela.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But you're a big star!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: No more.  I haven't worked in four years.  This town, it chews you up, then spits you out.  I'm just an ex-bogeyman.  Make a right.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: They don't want the classic horror films anymore.  Today, it's all giant bugs, giant spiders, giant grasshoppers -- who would believe such nonsense!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: The old ones were much spookier. They had castles, full moons...

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: They were <u>mythic</u>.  They had a poetry to them.  And you know what else?  The women prefer the traditional monsters.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: The <u>women</u>?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: The pure horror, it both repels and attracts them.  Because in their collective unconsciousness, they have the agony of childbirth.  The blood. The blood is horror.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I never thought of that.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Take my word for it.  You want to "score" with a young lady, you take her to see "Dracula."

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Shh!  I'm coming!  I will feed you!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well... I guess I should go.  Perhaps we could get together again?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Certainly.  But now the children of the night are calling me.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Ugh!  I hate the way she interrupts the pictures.  She doesn't show 'em the proper respect.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I think she's a honey.  Look at those jugs.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Vampira!  You will come under my spell!  You will be my slave of love.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hey Bela, how do you do that?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: You must be double-jointed, and you must be Hungarian.  Vampira, look at me!  Stare into my eyes.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I am getting tired.  I need to take my medicine.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Do you want me to get it for you?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: No thank you, Eddie.  I'll be alright.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Are you sure this is okay?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Don't worry.  I do it every Halloween.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Eddie, you got a new movie for me?!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah, it's gonna be a great picture! You'll love your character!  Bunny, Bela's here.  Look, hit the bars, work some parties, and get me transvestites!  <u>I need transvestites</u>!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Eddie, what kind of movie is this?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well, It's about how people have two personalities.  The side they show to the world, and then the secret person they hide inside.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Oh, like Jekyll and Hyde!  Ah, I've always wanted to play Jekyll and Hyde!  I'm looking forward to this production.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Ehh, your part's a little different. You're like the God that looks down on all the characters, and oversees everything.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well... you control everyone's fate. You're like the puppetmaster.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Ah, so I pull the strings!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah.  You pull the strings --  "Pull the strings"... hey, that's pretty good!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Bela! It's so great to see you!  And eight o'clock on the dot.  Right on time!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I am always on time.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Of course!  Well, we got a big day planned for you... First, we're gonna start off a little easy, with you in that armchair over there.  Then, once you're up to speed and cooking, we'll reset and bring out the laboratory equipment --

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Uh, Eddie, do you have my money?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Huh?!  Oh yeah, of course.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You're right, Bela.  Now Dracula, <u>that's</u> a part that takes acting.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Of course!  Dracula requires <u>presence</u>.  It's all in the voice, and the eyes, and the hand --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Look, you seem a little agitated. Do you maybe wanna take a little break, go for a nice walk... and then we'll come back and shoot the scene?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: BULLSHIT!  I am ready now!  Roll the camera!!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: How 'bout a western?  People love westerns.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: But, I don't like horses.  Do I have to get on one?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Eh, forget it.  What else is big?  Teenagers!  Jailbait pics!  Yeah... You got the juvenile delinquent, his girlfriend from the wrong side of the tracks --

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Who do I play?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Uh, a cop.  NO!  You play the father. He's <u>angry</u>!  He doesn't like seeing his son -- no -- he doesn't like seeing his <u>daughter</u> behave this way!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Well... can't I play the romantic part?  I'm tired of always being the bad guy.  You know, back in Hungary, I played Romeo!  I would like to be the lover again -- me, in a boat, with the girl...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Sure.  Romance, that's great!  To engineer your comeback, we're gonna need a whole slate of pictures.  Once "Glen Or Glenda" takes off, we'll slam you into one, then another, then another!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: That's good.  I could use the money.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But we need to start off with a bang! Something we <u>know</u> the audience will want to see.  Mmm.  What was your biggest hit?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Hmm... my biggest hit?  That would probably be "Dracula."

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Of course!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Those bastards at Universal.  I made so much money for them, and now I can't get the time of day.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So let's make another "Dracula." Let's make "The Return of Dracula"!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: We can't.  Those sons-a-bitches control the rights.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: They do?  Shoot.  There <u>must</u> be a way to get around that...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Ha-ha!  Dr. Acula!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Dracula?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No!  <u>Doctor Acula</u>!  You can still wear the cape, have the fangs... but you're a doctor!  Not a count.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Ah!  This is very exciting.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I gotta type this up, while it's still fresh!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Bela, what happened?!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I didn't feel well...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Let me take you to the hospital.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: No hospital.  Just take me to the couch...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Should I call a doctor?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Nah.  This happens all the time...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Is there anything I can get you? Water?  A blanket?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Goulash.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I don't know how to make goulash.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What's in the needle?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Morphine, with a demerol chaser.  Eddie, I'm so broke.  I don't know what I'm gonna do...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Don't worry.  I'll do something.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: "Greetings.  I am the Count."

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: "Greetings.  I am Slick Slomopavitz, Seeker of Adventure." Audience laughs.  Applause.  "Say, that's a funny place to sleep."

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: "It is my home."

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: "Oh, tract housing, huh?"  Laugh. "You need a new real estate agent."

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: "Beg to differ.  This casket incarpratates, er, inporporates --"

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No Bela, that's "incorporates."  Look, just say "This casket has..."

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Ach!  How do they expect a Hungarian to pronounce this dialogue?  This live television is madness!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Bela, don't worry.  You're better than all this crap.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I never said I could ad-lib...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Forget about it.  We'll make our new movie, and you'll be a star again.
